column5: I have been thinking about Allanwater and wondering if anyone has any feedback about the camp and the fishing.

Our group stopped going about 5 years ago. The big reason was travel time. Other reasons were about the camp and equipment. Hate to dog the camp, but it wasn't kept up like it should. Motors were always in need of something and when you travel 30 minutes or more just to start fishing it became a bit of an issue for us. The waters are good for walleye and pike. The sense of adventure is tremendous as you can travel great distances on the water and find something new all of the time. We completely enjoyed our day trip to Trout Rapids. I still get a letter telling us about the year they had. It seems that it is the same letter with just the date changed on it. If you go I would love to see a report.
thank you for your reply. I have been thinking a train in place may well be as good as a fly in, with a lower travel cost.
You might think that, but definitely do some research. Train fares can be ridiculous.
I believe the last time I went to Allanwater Bridge, round trip from Armstrong to Allanwater Bridge was about 40 dollars per person and no weight limit.
